intro: Casparia peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular Casparia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
